newsitem.title: UK: Nat Express bounces but rise seen muted.
newsitem.headline: Nat Express bounces but rise seen muted.

text.p: Shares in National Express Group Plc bounced eight pence to 498.5p by 0920 GMT, clawing back some of the gains lost after two planned rail acquisitions were referred to the Monopolies and Mergers Commission (MMC).

"Falls in the whole sector were overdone," noted one analyst, who agreed with the Financial Times' Lex Column that the move by the new Trade and Industry Secretary Margaret Beckett was based more on symbolism than substance.

Beckett on Thursday referred the acquisition of the ScotRail network and the Central Trains Ltd franchise to the MMC, saying they raised competition concerns. National Express' shares dived 5.5 percent.
But analysts said despite the uncertainty of a lengthy MMC inquiry weighing on the shares, National Express may come out of such an investigation better than before.

The Office of Fair Trading intended to tell the transport operator National Express to sell its Scottish coach business. The MMC can hardly demand more and may even decide that the company only has to sell parts of it, analysts said.
